title: Twickenham could host Six Nations games on Friday nights after World Cup success
title_page: Twickenham could host Six Nations games on Friday nights after World Cup success | Daily Mail Online
text:
Twickenham could host Six Nations fixtures on Friday nights from 2018 after successfully doing so during the recent World Cup.
England's World Cup opener against Fiji in September took place on a Friday night, as did one of their warm-up matches, with both seeing a spike in broadcasting figures.
Only Cardiff and Paris have hosted Friday night fixtures in Six Nations history since they were first introduced in 2009, but the Championship's organisers are open to the idea - although they have ruled out moving the Six Nations to align fixtures better with the southern hemisphere.
England's Dylan Hartley (right) takes on Wales' George North in the 2015 Six Nations in a Friday fixture
Sam Burgess takes on the Fiji defence in the opening match of the World Cup - again on a Friday night
John Feehan, the chief executive of the Six Nations, told the Telegraph: 'Now that we have had Friday nights at the World Cup there is no reason why we cannot consider doing a Friday night at Twickenham going forward.
'Clearly there are a few hurdles to overcome but Friday nights are available to us in two venues at the moment and we would expect that probably to increase as we go forward. It is not just Twickenham, it is the other venues as well.
'Friday nights have always been an issue in so far as there tend to be security logistic issues that people have quoted in the past and then there are issues around people worrying around hospitality and also in England, in particular, people have reasonable distances to travel to get to the games.
'But it has been a success. Friday nights have been a success in Paris and in Wales so I don't see why it wouldn't be a success anywhere else.'
